USA: The Twenty-second Amendment to the United States Constitution, establishing term limits for President, was ratified.

President Truman relieved General Douglas MacArthur of his commands after criticizing the limited war efforts of the Truman administration, and starting unauthorized talks with China in the Korean war.
The Japanese Peace Treaty Conference was held San Francisco.
The Mutual Security Act was signed into law.
Taiwan: Land Reform in Taiwan: The government starts selling public land to tenant farmers, nearly a fifth of Taiwan's arable land
Poland: Trial of the Generals who served in the anti-Nazi resistance during World War II
Philippine: Fort Santiago was declared a National Shrine.
The National Movement for Free Elections (NAMFREL) is established
The Mutual Defense Treaty between Philippines and United States was signed.

Nicasio “Asiong” Salonga, branded as Tondo’s Public Enemy No. 1 and the kingpin of Manila, was shot and killed by Ernesto Reyes, a henchman of his rival and also notorious gang leader Carlos “Totoy Golem” Capistrano.
Nepal: End of Rana rule. Sovereignty of crown restored and anti-Rana rebels in Nepalese Congress Party form government
Malaysia: Assassination of Sir Henry Gurney: British High Commissioner Sir Henry Gurney was killed by members of the Malayan Communist Party in Fraser's Hill.
Indonesia: The composition of the new cabinet is announced. The new Prime Minister is Dr. Sukiman Wirjosanjojo.
India: Congress Party wins first general elections under leadership of Jawaharlal Nehru. (to 1952)
Iceland: The United States Army establishes a base in Keflavík.
Haiti: President Magloire of Haiti and President Trujillo of the Dominican Republic meet for diplomatic talks

The Haitian Institute of Statistics (Institut Haïtien de Statistique) and the Haitian Institute of Farming and Industrial Credit (Institut Haïtien de Crédit Agricole et Industriel) are established by the government
Germany: The Inner Six European nations including West Germany signed the Treaty of Paris establishing the European Coal and Steel Community, a single market in coal and steel governed by supranational institutions.
France: Treaty of Paris: Establishment of the European Coal and Steel Community (ECSC) between France, West Germany, Italy, and the Benelux countries, producing diplomatic and economic stability in Europe between former enemy states. The ECSC is credited as one of the major "ancestors" of the European Union.
Cuba: Eduardo Chibás, leader of the Ortodoxo party and mentor of Fidel Castro, commits suicide during a live radio broadcast.
Brazil: The Brazilian Medical Association is founded.
The Escola Superior de Propaganda e Marketing is founded in São Paulo.
Belgium: Treaty of Paris signed, establishing the European Coal and Steel Community.
Baudouin of Belgium sworn in as king
Barbados: Election: The first election with universal adult suffrage.
Australia: Voters reject a referendum to change the Constitution to allow the Menzies Government to ban the Communist Party
Australia signs the ANZUS treaty with the United States and New Zealand
Albania: Albania and the Soviet Union signed an agreement on mutual economic assistance.
